{"step_by_step_thinking": "Mitochondria are known as the powerhouses of the cell because they generate most of the cell's supply of adenosine triphosphate (ATP), used as a source of chemical energy. DNA synthesis (B) also occurs in mitochondria, as they have their own DNA separate from the cell's nuclear DNA.
